intro: Vallaris indecora, commonly known as the false sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. Vallaris indecora is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
